title: Singapore, U.S. take part in annual maritime exercise
description: SINGAPOREï¼Œ July 17 (Xinhua) -- Singapore's Ministry of Defence announced Tuesday that the Republic of Singapore Navy and the United States Navy are participating in the 18th Singapore-U.S. Cooperation Afloat Readiness and Training (CARAT) exercise in the South China Sea from 17 to 27 July 2012.
cleanContent: SINGAPORE, July 17 (Xinhua) -- Singapore's Ministry of Defence announced Tuesday that the Republic of Singapore Navy and the United States Navy are participating in the 18th Singapore-U.S. Cooperation Afloat Readiness and Training (CARAT) exercise in the South China Sea from 17 to 27 July 2012.The Republic of Singapore Air Force, the United States Air Force, the United States Coast Guard and the United States Marine Corps will also jointly take part in this exercise.With a total of 1,400 personnel from both countries, the exercise will focus on sharpening conventional maritime capabilities such as anti-air, anti-surface and anti-submarine warfare, as well as maritime air operations, the ministry said in a statement.Singapore's navy and air force will have seven ships, a submarine, a naval helicopter and seven aircraft, while the U.S. participants will see four ships, a submarine, three naval helicopters and six aircraft during this exercise.The ministry said the CARAT series of bilateral maritime exercises are held annually since 1995, aiming at enhancing interoperability and professional cooperation between the participating forces of Singapore and the U.S.																																																																								|  |
